text:
A test statistic is calculated by comparing the point estimate of the population parameter
with the hypothesized value of the parameter (i.e., the value specified in the null
hypothesis). With reference to our option return example, this means we are concerned
with the difference between the mean return of the sample (i.e., x = 0.001) and the
hypothesized mean return (i.e., Po = 0). As indicated in the following expression, the test
